metadata.title: CVE-2018-11233 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - low
metadata.description:
In Git before 2.13.7, 2.14.x before 2.14.4, 2.15.x before 2.15.2, 2.16.xbefore 2.16.4, and 2.17.x before 2.17.1, code to sanity-check pathnames onNTFS can result in reading out-of-bounds memory.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-11233` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

git - 1:1.9.1-1ubuntu0.8
git-all - 1:1.9.1-1ubuntu0.8
git-arch - 1:1.9.1-1ubuntu0.8
git-bzr - 1:1.9.1-1ubuntu0.8
git-core - 1:1.9.1-1ubuntu0.8
git-cvs - 1:1.9.1-1ubuntu0.8
git-daemon-run - 1:1.9.1-1ubuntu0.8
git-daemon-sysvinit - 1:1.9.1-1ubuntu0.8
git-el - 1:1.9.1-1ubuntu0.8
git-email - 1:1.9.1-1ubuntu0.8
git-gui - 1:1.9.1-1ubuntu0.8
git-man - 1:1.9.1-1ubuntu0.8
git-mediawiki - 1:1.9.1-1ubuntu0.8
git-svn - 1:1.9.1-1ubuntu0.8
gitk - 1:1.9.1-1ubuntu0.8
gitweb - 1:1.9.1-1ubuntu0.8
No subscription required

criterions.comment: git package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:1.9.1-1ubuntu0.8').
